page.title: 09NAIRN:THE BEACH
page.content: Nairn's beach is very important for recreation for locals and visitors.It spreads along to the North- West where the{golf course}faces out to the Black Isle.The beach is{sand-stone rock covered in seaweed.The{council has dumped large rocks at the shore to stop the sea eroding it. From the{Golf club house}there runs a{sewage pipe}which flows out to the sea.Near the golf club there is an old {sand-stone}quarry once used for building.A path runs along the beach. It is quite new as bad{storms}last year eroded the old one. To the East,the swimming pool area used to be a sand-stone quarry,now a picnic area with a putting green and two public toilets. This part of the beach is sandier and the council have dumped rocks here as well,though most of them are covered in sand.
